resources.string: Final
Title image
Start
Ruby sleeping
Ruby...it\'s your first day at your software engineering internship. Wake up!
They made a mistake. I\'m not good enough. I\'ll try again next year.
I\'m really nervous, but no intern knows everything their first day. Let\'s do this.
Scene2
Dummy Button
DUMMY\nCONTENT
Sad Ruby
Imposter syndrome got the best of you, holding you back from an amazing summer of learning and building a strong network with other amazing women and role models in the technology industry.
Find out more about Imposter syndrome
Play again
Even though you\'re anxious about your first day, you show up. Unfortunately, your first encounter is not a positive one.
A man approaches you as you walk in, \"Oh hi! You must be the new diversity hire!\"
Tech Bro
Brush it off with a smile. He doesn\'t mean anything by it.
Introduce yourself as the new software engineering intern. Then, with a confused look, inquire why he thought you were the diversity hire.
While this might not be an automatic gameover, it can certainly lead to one. Systematic workplace sexism is one of the reasons women fail to thrive in tech.
Find out more about standing up to workplace sexism
Victorious Ruby

Caught off guard by your question, and perhaps a bit ashamed of his assumption, your new colleague struggles to explain himself. You excuse yourself to sign in with HR. You are proud of yourself for calling attention to implicit sexism and you look forward to new, exciting experiences at your internship.
